page.title: 11Porthgwarra Cove, St. Levan.
page.content: Porthgwarra is a{fishing cove}with a 'slip' for small boats. A winch is used to pull them up the slip. There are various types of fish off the coast, also crabs and lobsters. Only two men use the cove regularly today. {They catch crab and lobsters}which are stored in other pots at sea near the cove, then sold at{Newlyn Fish Market. Centuries old stone storage tanks were used until heavy seas damaged the wooden covers recently.{Miners dug the {hole in the cliff years ago so farmers {could take seaweed for manure with a {horse and cart,}another tunnel allowed access to the storage tanks. {Mr. Leslie Trewern,}who fishes from Porthgwarra,{uses a fibre-glass hulled boat which is about five metres long. It has a Stuart-Turner{petrol engine and he always takes a small{two-way {radio in case of emergency.}(cont.)
